Polrun grew around a water source and a well-traveled road, and is comprised <span class="tip dotted" title=" Half-Orc: 60.41%, Goblin: 12.64%, Dwarf: 6.40%, Human: 6.12%, Halfling: 4.20%, Dragonborn: 3.39%, Tiefling: 2.56%, Gnome: 1.55%, Elf: 1.49%, Half-Elf: 1.25%">mostly of half-orcs</span>. They are a <span class="tip dotted" title="Women occupy most positions of authority.">matriarchal</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="The crown gives land to the nobles in exchange for military service. town: <br><span class="first-character">P</span>olrun is located in the tropical plains, where the vegetation is sparse. Polrun grew around a water source and a well-traveled road. They harvest dairy cows, and nearby is a region rich with common fauna used in alchemy.They are a <span class="tip dotted" title="The crown gives land to the nobles in exchange for military service. Peasants work, tithe, and fight for the nobles in exchange for being able to live on the noble's lands.">feudalist</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="Governed by the best.">meritocratic</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="An elected body of representatives wield the powers of government.">republic</span>. The nearest <span class="tip" title="This changes each time you click."><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">landmark</a></span> is <span id="random">a twenty foot high mushroom, enclosed in a circle of smaller mushrooms of varying heights(up to 5 feet). A history check reveals this location to have been home to a giant toad who would rest on the largest mushroom. Occasionally a ghostly ribbit pierces the air.</span> A population of 1241, the denizens live a poor existence. A midwinter festival is currently taking place.<br><h3>Government in Polrun</h3>The people of Polrun work the land in exchange for working their lord's lands. Affairs are handled by the competent, the head of whom is Mr <span class="tip" id="acb53912-a1bc-45c2-9d9d-b850fd91ae55"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Karg Krokk</a></span><br><h4>Economics</h4>Trade in Polrun is regulated, with taxes applied to all goods and services rendered, and people live a poor existence because of it. The trade guild enforces rules, with penalties for rule-breakers. Welfare is terrible. Citizens can expect the absolute bare minimum of death services. Healthcare and education are ignored, and those unable to fend for themselves would go hungry if it weren't for private benefactors. <h4>Law and Order</h4>There is a guard presence in Polrun, but it is more for outside intruders rather than the population inside. Citizens are expected to follow the laws, and those that do have nothing to fear from <span class="tip" id="f44ad27e-5c17-4f09-9bd0-3f8f11fe3321"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">The Killers</a></span>, who take care of policing matters. Law in Polrun is punitive, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in rare instances, execution. Magic is typically reserved for those with a license. There is some magic, but is mostly for personal use, and sometimes commercial.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>Racial Demographics</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of Factions</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of NPCs</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of Buildings</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>List of Throwaway NPCs</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h3>Professions in Polrun</h3></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span>

buildings.d5bfbe1d-1f12-4ea0-9b72-397fb09eceab: <h1>The Town Square</h1><br>You're in the town square. It's somewhat cramped, and overflowing with refuse and other garbage. It features a protected plinth with the town's most important relic which is the riding saddle of a noble who once visited. There are several guards next to or near the plinth. As you enter the town square, you see <span class="tip" id="1f527105-f597-481e-8aa3-c4e027064821"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">a translucent skinned taller than average human</a></span> clearly drunk off their ass just wandering about.<br>There's a <span class="tip" id="37f4b4fc-bf0e-4229-91da-cfbd6ea85518"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">beuraucrat</a></span> that's trying to calm an angry crowd. There's also a noticeboard, which has various posters, requests, and announcements tacked to it.<br><br><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"></span><br><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="poster"></div></span>
buildings.a05379dc-1f3e-42a4-b491-6b2545e2ef29: <h1>The Potter Lane emporium</h1>You wander through the streets of Polrun, and come across the market, which is located in the seedier side of town. It seems that the vendors are organised by the social class to which the vendor caters. The market is known for having every type of food imaginable, and is surprisingly clean. Today the market is basically empty, and no one is around to hear the cries of the merchants.<br><br><h3>Merchants</h3> <br>Off to the side, a <span class="tip" id="b26385c6-7320-4aa5-825a-c0dddb613bcf"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">quite solidly built male half-orc</a></span> is selling whale oil from a very colorful caravan wagon.<br><br>Nearby, a <span class="tip" id="2b58fce9-28ce-4676-b91a-feeae5ce5751"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">built like a wrestler half-orc</a></span> is beckoning "Breastplates with gargoyles faces engraved on them! You'd be a fool to pass it up!" from a huge sack the merchant has set down on the ground.<br><br>Off to the side, a <span class="tip" id="f5ac43b5-3972-4ce3-8d36-9e077e73f151"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">young adult human</a></span> is selling dried whole grain from a huge sack the merchant has set down on the ground.<br><br>A <span class="tip" id="0c71bb06-8bf7-43dd-be5d-a0f9f573ff8f"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">dark tan skinned very tall dragonborn</a></span> is calling to any who would listen: "Lost? Why not find your way home with a homing badger! Guaranteed to find their way home! Don't waste any more time, buy today!" from a little push cart.<br><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h4>Who else is there?</h4></a><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><span id="moreSellers"></span></span><br><br>A <span class="tip" id="e39d39b7-174b-4cd8-a4f8-cb031800a9e0"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">fair skinned relatively short half-orc</a></span> is selling magical trinkets from a very colorful caravan wagon. Or, at least, they're supposedly magical items.<br><select id="listbox-buildingmagicselection" name="listbox-buildingmagicselection" tabindex="0" class="macro-listbox"><option value="0">Ring</option><option value="1">Weapon</option><option value="2">Armour</option><option value="3">Trinket</option></select> — <br><br><span id="magic"></span>
buildings.c676f7d8-2125-43b1-912e-41f7ef48c37e: <h1>$building.name</h1> <blockquote> As you make your way along Old Close a parchment flies through the street and the wind flaps it on your face. It is a saucy love letter to 'My burly bear' from 'Your naughty little minx'. </blockquote> <br><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down Old Close, and enter a structurally unsound straw general store with a grey undefined roof and see that inside, the large building is very tidy. $building.clutter You notice there is a small shelf filled with different colored lumpy candles labeled "Homemade Candles" . The store's shopkeep is currently polishing a grappling hook.<br><br><h3>Shopkeeper</h3><br>The shopkeep nods at you when you come up to the counter. She introduces herself as <span class="tip" id="4aae5290-a8ac-4c57-9f98-c2d3d94b3776"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Lagazi Karaktoth</a></span>, the caretaker of the General Store, and warns you that you may want to buy a medical kit as there has been a recent outbreak of flu in town according to her. Lagazi speaks to every customer in a very monotone voice.<br><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h4>Buy a magic trinket</h4></a><span id="Trinket"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h4>Buy something</h4></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Customers</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>
buildings.29eaa15a-605b-471d-b20c-bf77f9d7694a: <h1>Polrun Dungeon</h1>Polrun Dungeon is suspended off of the underside of an overhang, dangling with a precarious path up to it and was built as a later addition. It is known for its quirky jailer, and consists of a sprawling maze of twisting passages. It is rumoured that hidden inside the dungeon is the corpse of a deposed king or queen.<br><h4>Cells</h4>The cells inside the dungeon are aging, but sturdy; the walls have some cracks, and prisoners are kept in individual cells, but they can hear other prisoners. Prisoners of Polrun Dungeon are treated humanely; they receive reasonable meals, some exercise, and healing when needed. The jailer, <span class="tip" id="b195152a-ccbe-469b-9d1a-732a615b380c"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Topsyturvy Zokdit</a></span>, is a bard, who sings the worst songs to to the prisoners (who are referred to as 'the audience').<br><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Meet a prisoner</a><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="prisoners"></div></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="b195152a-ccbe-469b-9d1a-732a615b380c"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Topsyturvy Zokdit</a></span></td> <td>Goblin</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="Supervises a jail and the prisoners in it.">Jailer</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="Polrun Dungeon is a workplace to Topsyturvy">Jailer</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div>

You notice a plethora of small pots brimming with daffodils dotted around the shop.<br><br>This botany shop is known for being rumored to be an arm to a large secret organization of flower shops that run the world as we know it. buildings.a9073fda-4da2-43eb-8e48-946efae175aa: <h1>Siren Song</h1> <blockquote> As you make your way along Common Market everyone in this town keeps trying to sell you everything imaginable, but they all make a point that they will not, under any circumstances, be selling you their hair. Not that you ever asked. </blockquote> <span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down Common Market, and enter Siren Song a decently built straw building with a weathered thatched roof. Inside, the average sized straw building is dangerously messy. You notice the scent of lilac perfume in the air.<br>When people talk about Siren Song, they say the goddess of love and fertility blessed this place and all her followers must visit. Apparently, it specialises in slave trading. All the people here have a price..<br>Rumours abound in whorehouses, and Siren Song is no different; apparently, the entire building is haunted and ghosts will harass you as you try to enjoy your time.<br><br><h3>Brothel Master</h3><br>The Master is applying a generous layer of powdered makeup, he appears to be a tyrannical and cruel fellow. Upon noticing your arrival the dragonborn frowns, but greets you just the same, and quickly walks over to where you are. He introduces himself as <span class="tip" id="02618221-474e-4bd7-a9f3-0c3e9e4f4b68"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Kriv Norixius</a></span>, the Master of Siren Song, and asks what he can do for you.<br><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h4>Meet one of the harlots</h4></a><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="harlot"></div></span><br><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Customers</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

factions.f44ad27e-5c17-4f09-9bd0-3f8f11fe3321: <h1>The Killers</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Killers is an assassins company. It's extremely old, and the miniscule faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by power. They are rumoured to employ dangerous criminals.<br><h3>Policing</h3><br>Polrun is policed by The Killers, rather than a separate guard. The guard is slightly underfunded, and their equipment sometimes falls into slight disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions, though The Killers does not have the funding to perform regular training exercises.<br><br>One can recognise a member of The Killers by the their tendency to blink quickly.<br><h4>Law in Polrun</h4><br>Law in Polrun is punitive, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in rare instances, execution.<br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="0e0195b1-3d29-42df-af5a-bcc5c5fd40c9"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Perrin Brightmoon</a></span>, who was able to rise to power through nepotism. He is of mild incompetence, and his position is relatively unstable. Bribes are scorned. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Killers are identifiable by their tendency to blink quickly. Membership requires referral by an existing member, and costs three hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Killers involves a secret task.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="0e0195b1-3d29-42df-af5a-bcc5c5fd40c9"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Perrin Brightmoon</a></span></td> <td>Halfling</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A sneaky person.">Rogue</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Killers, and is of mild incompetence.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. One or two old favours are part of those resources. Also at their disposal are a couple pouches of gold, one or two valuable magical weapons, one or two valuable trade goods, and one or two valuable gems. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Killers have barely any allies; More than a couple knights are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>The Killers have some fearsome enemies; A guild of scholars are enemies of The Killers, as are a guild of mercenaries, a guild of mercenaries, and a guild of mercenaries.
factions.048efced-535c-4f9b-a4a4-3e6e1936a101: <h1>The Group of Visionaries</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Group of Visionaries is an artisans guild. It's extremely old, and the somewhat small faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by fame. They are distrusted by those in power.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="3e62d011-0597-4193-a9d4-21ac1da5e263"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Dren Krokk</a></span>, who was able to oust the previous leadership. He is quite competent, and his position is stable due to the lack of infighting for the leadership role. Bribes are a regular part of business. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Group of Visionaries are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires some social status, and costs five hundred gold pieces. The initiation into The Group of Visionaries involves an oath to be taken.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="3e62d011-0597-4193-a9d4-21ac1da5e263"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Dren Krokk</a></span></td> <td>Half-orc</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="Creates some form of art.">Artisan</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Group of Visionaries, and is quite competent.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A handful of debtors are in their proverbial warchest, as are a fair few old favours, a handful of favours, a handful of contacts, and a handful of magical weapons. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Group of Visionaries have some strong allies; A veritable army of thieves and a veritable army of monks can be called on for aid. <br><br>The Group of Visionaries have more enemies than one would expect; A guild of assassins wish ill of The Group of Visionaries. Their other enemies also include a guild of bandits, and a guild of commoners.
factions.6f7da835-8599-4a5f-a48f-940e95f75722: <h1>The Dinner Club of Distinguished Men</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Dinner Club of Distinguished Men is a nobles society. It's quite new, and the tiny faction has a very good reputation, and is motivated by politics. They are distrusted by the people.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by a committee of 7, who were the wealthiest of the group. They are reasonably competent, and their positions on the committee are very unstable due to conflicts with rivaling factions. Their meetings are held every ten days, and are are open to people accompanied by a member. Bribes to the committee are uncommon, and frowned upon. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Dinner Club of Distinguished Men are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires some social status, and costs five hundred gold pieces. The initiation into The Dinner Club of Distinguished Men involves a secret ritual.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> </div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A couple pouches of gold are part of those resources. Also at their disposal are a drawer of blackmail material, a handful of favours, a handful of magical weapons, and one or two valuable gems. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Dinner Club of Distinguished Men have barely any allies; A handful of bards are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>The Dinner Club of Distinguished Men have some fearsome enemies; A guild of bandits are enemies of The Dinner Club of Distinguished Men, as are a guild of assassins, a guild of commoners, and a guild of commoners.
